title: Where were England's 2019 World Cup heroes in 2003?
text:
When Jonny Wilkinson dropped the winning goal with just 26 seconds to go in the 2003 World Cup final, it was a moment no England fan will ever ­forget.

At least, not unless you were still barely of school age at the time – like several members of the side who beat New Zealand 19-7. Sam Underhill, Saturday's man of the match, was just seven, star lock ­forward Maro Itoje was nine, and Tom Curry, the 21-year-old flanker, was only five.

Itoje, now 24, was more interested in football growing up in a Nigerian family. His first rugby match did not come until 2006, so the heroics of his predecessor Martin Johnson against ­Australia went largely unnoticed.

He said: “I remember going into school on the Monday – I must have been nine years old – and they were saying on the news how England had won the Rugby World Cup. I was like: ‘Yeah, big deal’ and cracked on.”
description: When Jonny Wilkinson dropped the winning goal with just 26 seconds to  go in the 2003 World Cup final, it  was a moment no England fan will  ever ­forget.
